definition: to straighten out/to sort out/to organize
texture/grain (of wood)/inner essence/intrinsic order/reason/logic/truth/science/natural science (esp. physics)/to manage/to pay attention to/to run (affairs)/to handle/to put in order/to tidy up
to obey/to follow/to arrange/to make reasonable/along/favorable

sentences.english: We must rationalize our regulatory system. The regulator must have the capacity to regulate comprehensive services.
sentences.chinese: 我們必須理順監管體制。
她理順了亂蓬蓬的頭髮。

sentences.english: Make smooth raw material inspection and storage procedures and strengthen rechecking of samples for witness of raw material storage.
sentences.chinese: 理順原材料進庫檢驗及儲存，加強進庫見證取樣複檢。

sentences.english: We cannot speed up the reform without rationalizing prices.
sentences.chinese: 理順物價，改革才能加快步伐。

sentences.english: Zoom in, out, or use colored nodes to create order out of that chaos.
sentences.chinese: 放大，縮小，或者使用色標理順想法。

sentences.english: Eighth, consummate the system of popularizing agricultural technique.
sentences.chinese: 八是完善理順農技推廣體系。

sentences.english: A men's T-shirt should be face down and smoothed out before you fold it.
sentences.chinese: 一個男人的T恤應該是朝下並理順之前，把它摺疊。

sentences.english: Want to keep your plaster pliable a bit longer to get it all smoothed out?
sentences.chinese: 要保留你的石膏柔韌多一點的時間來把一切理順嗎？

sentences.english: One, the relation that straightens enterprise of local power supply and provincial power company.
sentences.chinese: 理順地方供電企業與省級電力公司的關係。

sentences.english: You should straighten up your ideas first.
sentences.chinese: 你得先把你的思路理順。

sentences.english: The government is making unprecedented efforts to stanch the bleeding.
sentences.chinese: 美國政府正在採取史無前例的行動來理順經濟。

sentences.english: The distribution of the graduates needs to be straightened out.
sentences.chinese: 畢業生分配關係沒有理順。

sentences.english: A gentle, relaxing gel, formulated to help reduce puffiness and smooth out fine lines.
sentences.chinese: 柔和輕鬆凝膠以幫助減少浮腫和理順幼紋。
